intro: Dicliptera ochrochlamys, commonly known as the yellow-flowered grass, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellow to orange flowers, which bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savannas and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
